channel.description: Recent content in programming on DW Blog

item.title: Jupyterlab on Linux Server
item.description: Jupyterlab on linux server Overview Installation Virtual environment Issues Reference Overview Jupyterlab is a lightweight but comprehensive and full-development IDE. In addition to write scripts with nice highlights syntax for Python and R as I know, the notebook is probably the most well-known feature with which users are able to write codes along with markdown-style notes. Besides, if you are a user who tends to install as less softwares/packages on your local machine as possible, running Jupyterlab on remote server may be suitable for you.

item.title: MATLAB installation in Ubuntu (Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS)
item.description: MATLAB installation in Ubuntu (Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS) Overview MATLAB is a powerful programming language/software when it comes to matrix computing. Although it is not a open-source software, as a bioinformatician, I still need to use it sometimes for my research. In this blog, I will introduce how to install MATLAB in your local machine with Ubuntu as your OS. Procedure Firstly, we have to download a version of MATLAB that is suitable for your work and your hardware.
